block.p: Donald Scott Kane and David Feiner Willard Robison were married yesterday at the Roundhouse Community Center in Vancouver, British Columbia. Diane Brown, a provincial marriage commissioner, officiated.

Mr. Kane (above, left) is 40. He is a computer programmer at Norwesco Computing, a Seattle company, which supplies software to garbage and recycling companies. He graduated from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He is a son of Mary Jo and David Kane of Issaquah, Wash. His mother retired as a librarian at Collège du Léman, a private school in Versoix, Switzerland. His father retired as a senior communications satellite consultant at the International Telecommunications Union, a United Nations organization in Geneva that coordinates radio and telephony standards.
Donald Scott Kane and David Feiner Willard Robison were married Saturday at the Roundhouse Community Center in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Donald Scott Kane and David Feiner Willard Robison were married yesterday at the Roundhouse Community Center in Vancouver, British Columbia. Diane Brown, a provincial marriage commissioner, officiated.

Mr. Kane (above, left) is 40. He is a computer programmer at Norwesco Computing, a Seattle company, which supplies software to garbage and recycling companies. He graduated from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He is a son of Mary Jo and David Kane of Issaquah, Wash. His mother retired as a librarian at Collège du Léman, a private school in Versoix, Switzerland. His father retired as a senior communications satellite consultant at the International Telecommunications Union, a United Nations organization in Geneva that coordinates radio and telephony standards.

Mr. Robison, 39, works in Seattle as a creative director for computer software, Web sites and DVD's. He is also a lecturer in technical, project and team management at the University of Washington Extension in Seattle and at the university's campus in Tacoma. He graduated from the University of Chicago and received a master's in library and information science from the University of California, Berkeley. He is the son of Dr. Robert K. Robison of Meyerstown, Pa., and the late Arlyne Robison, and the stepson of Marjorie Robison. His mother was a clinical social worker in private practice and for the Salvation Army in New York. His father, who is retired, was a psychologist in New York.
